title: While Loops
description: Learn to repeat code while a condition is true using while loops

content.introduction:
Often in programming, you need to repeat the same actions multiple times. Loops allow you to execute code repeatedly without writing it over and over.

The `while` loop is the most basic type of loop - it continues executing as long as a condition remains true.

### What You'll Learn
- Basic while loop syntax
- Loop counters and conditions
- Infinite loops and how to avoid them
- Accumulation patterns
- Nested while loops

concepts.title: While Loop
concepts.description: Repeats a block of code as long as the condition is true: while condition do statement

concepts.title: Loop Counter
concepts.description: A variable that tracks how many times the loop has executed

concepts.title: Infinite Loop
concepts.description: A loop that never stops because its condition never becomes false - usually a bug!

concepts.title: Loop Accumulator
concepts.description: A variable that accumulates values during loop iterations (e.g., a running total)

exercises.title: Multiplication Table
exercises.description: Write a program that displays the multiplication table for 7 (7x1 through 7x10) using a while loop.
hints: Create a counter variable starting at 1
Multiply 7 by the counter in each iteration
Don't forget to increment the counter!

exercises.title: Factorial Calculator
exercises.description: Calculate the factorial of a number (e.g., 5! = 5 * 4 * 3 * 2 * 1 = 120). Use a while loop.
hints: Create a counter starting at n
Multiply result by counter each iteration

exercises.title: Number Guessing Game
exercises.description: Create a simple number guessing game. The secret number is 42. Keep asking until the user guesses correctly, giving 'too high' or 'too low' hints.
hints: Use a boolean variable to track if the number is found
Read the user's guess inside the loop
Set found to True when guess matches

exercises.title: Sum of Even Numbers
exercises.description: Calculate the sum of all even numbers from 2 to 20 using a while loop.
hints: Add num to sum each iteration
Increment num by 2 (to get next even number)

content.summary:
Excellent work! You've learned:

- **While loop syntax**: Repeating code while a condition is true
- **Loop counters**: Tracking iterations with a variable
- **Accumulators**: Building up values across iterations
- **Loop conditions**: Making sure loops eventually stop
- **Nested loops**: Loops within loops for complex patterns

While loops are powerful tools for repetition when you don't know in advance how many times to loop!
content.nextSteps: Next, you'll learn about **for loops** - a more convenient way to loop when you know exactly how many times you want to repeat something!
